results.title: Surgery in chest diseases
results.creator_credit: A. Reginald Dobson, British Council and Gaumont-British Instructional
results.brief_description: A study of a civilian Chest Surgery Centre, showing all the stages in medical treatment from early diagnosis by mass radiography to rehabilitation and final cure. A patient is diagnosed as having a cancer of the lung, and the operation for total removal of the lung is shown in detail.

results.title: Surfmovies
results.creator_credit: Albie Thoms and Albie Thoms Productions
results.brief_description: Using clips from newsreels and surf movies, notably “Crystal Voyager”, made in Australia over the last fifty years, and interviewing filmmakers and others involved in the multi-million dollar Australian surfing industry, this documentary shows the close relationship between surf movies and the sport that usually see Australians as the world champions. Contains some b&w footage.

results.title: Surface tension
results.brief_description: Reviews the nature and shows some applications of surface tension: comparison of solids, gases and liquids with reference to size and shape; demonstration of how the surface of water behaves like an elastic skin; effect of modifying the surface by addition of camphor, ether and soap; surface tension seen in films and bubbles; capillary action; applications including blotting paper, lamp wick, candle, paint brush and killing of mosquito larvae.

results.title: Surf beach [Italian Version]
results.creator_credit: Bern Gandy, John Martin-Jones and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: The hundreds of thousands of Australian who visit the beach each summer seldom realise that ceaseless work is required to keep the beach clean and safe. This film shows the activities of those who work to protect swimmers and guarantee their enjoyment of the beach. NB: In Italian with no English subtitles.

results.title: Supply and drainage ditches
results.creator_credit: J.J. Walker and CSIRO. Film Unit
results.brief_description: Stresses the need for control of irrigation water by the design and construction of ditches capable of handling an adequate flow of water. Describes the design, lay-out and construction of an efficient irrigation system without which fertile land may be ruined by water logging and salting.
results.description: Stresses the need for control of irrigation water by the design and construction of ditches capable of handling an adequate flow of water. results.title: Supervising: developing co-operation
results.creator_credit: Caravel Films and United States. Dept. of the Navy
results.brief_description: Points out that the efficiency of an organisation depends on the morale of its personnel and then shows how office supervisors can help to foster a spirit of cooperation among civilian personnel. Right and wrong ways of supervision are demonstrated.

results.title: Supersonic
results.brief_description: In 1956 it had all begun, the sound barrier had been broken and a handful of men were thinking of making a passenger airline to break the sound barrier - to halve the world. In 1959, real work was begun on the idea. The French and the British consolidated to save time and money. In 1962 a model of the aircraft was shown at Farnsborough Air Show, and it was named “Concorde”. America became interested, and not wanting to be left behind, began designing their own sound breaking passenger aircraft. The race was on - neither of the parties wanting to make any mistakes, both very meticulous in their research. This documentary is mostly made up of interviews with the chief personnel (French, English and American) involved in designing, testing and investigating the construction of a supersonic aircraft. Commentary by Michael Flanders.

results.title: Superb lyrebird
results.brief_description: This synchronised picture and sound record of the territorial calls and display of the lyrebird was produced to help the Division of Wildlife Research to correlate the bird’s throat and beak movements with the sound produced.
